properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Walkerville, Walkerville North, Walkerville South.

  • Due to a whale carcass, there could be an increase in shark activity at Walkerville North Beach. 
  • A whale carcass can attract sharks to the area and mean they are closer to the shore than normal.
  • While it is not uncommon for sharks to be present off the Victorian coast, you should exercise additional caution in the area.
  • The Victorian Fisheries Authority is assisting Park Rangers with the management of the whale carcass.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued on 22 December.
Stay informed and do not enter the water at closed beaches.
What you should do:
  • If you see sharks, report the sighting by calling Triple Zero (000) or notify lifesavers immediately if you are at a patrolled beach.
  • Take extra caution in the area by swimming at patrolled beaches and not surfing or diving in the area.

Staying safe at nearby beaches:
  • Always swim, dive or surf with a friend.
  • Swim between the red and yellow flags on patrolled beaches.
  • Don't swim in places where human or animal waste enters the water.
  • Keep away from large schools of fish, seals or other wildlife as these can attract sharks.
This message was issued by Victorian Fisheries Authority.

The next update is expected by 05/01/2022 06:00 pm or as the situation changes.

For more information on staying safe around sharks:
  • www.vfa.vic.gov.au/shark-smart.
Stay informed:
  • Via www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
  • Call the VicEmergency Hotline to talk to someone about this warning on 1800 226 226 (freecall).
  • People who are deaf, hard of hearing, or who have a speech/communication impairment can contact VicEmergency Hotline via the National Relay Service on 1800 555 677.
  • For help with English, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to telephone VicEmergency Hotline. If you know someone who cannot speak English, provide them with this number.
  • Download the VicEmergency app or follow VicEmergency on Twitter or Facebook.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Rocklyn and surrounding areas.

  • There is a grassfire at Dean-Barkstead Rd, Rocklyn that is not yet under control.
  • This grassfire is travelling from Dean-Barkstead Road in an easterly direction towards Wombat. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 01/01/2022 07:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message has been issued for Jarosite Headland, near Bells Beach.

  • Landslip and rockfall has occurred in the Jarosite Headland area.
Stay informed. Stay away from the area. The cliff may continue to move for hours or days afterwards.
What you should do:
  • Landslips and rockfalls are unpredictable and can occur without warning.
  • While the rest of the beach is open, visitors should take note of signage and advice from Parks Victoria staff in the area.
Impacts in your area:
  • A section of beach at Jarosite Headlands, between Point Addis and Southside, has been closed. 
This message was issued by Parks Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/01/2022 02:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#viclandslide).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is for Langkoop, Poolaijelo, Powers Creek.

  • There is a grass and scrub fire at Poolaijelo that is not yet under control.
  • This grassfire is travelling in a north-easterly direction and has crossed Fergusons Road, near Ryans Road. 
  • Surrounding communities may see smoke from fire activity in the Meereek State forest. 
  • Fire crews have been building containment lines around the northern and eastern sides of the forest to help stop the spread of the fire. 
  • Weather conditions forecast for today may cause the fire to become dangerous and unpredictable and it may impact properties.
  • A relief centre is open at Edenhope Senior Citizens Centre, 54 Langford Street, Edenhope, and closes at 5:00pm.
Don't wait - If you are not prepared to stay, leaving now is the safest option. Conditions may change and get worse very quickly. Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
What you should do:

The best protection from radiant heat and smoke is distance.

Travel to:
  • The home of family or friends that is away from the warning area.
  • When you leave, remember to take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.
  • If you encounter smoke or flames while travelling, turn around and drive to safety. If you're unable to turn around and drive to safety, a car offers more protection from the fire's heat than being caught on foot in the open.
  • If you are away from home, do not return.

In the car:
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety. 
  • Slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.

If you choose to stay, seek shelter indoors: 
  • Bring your pets indoors.
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents.
  • Turn off cooling systems.
  • Shelter in a room that has a door and a window to the outside so you can keep an eye on what is happening with the fire.
Impacts in your area:
The following roads are closed:
  • Casterton-Apsley Road between Dergholm-Edenhope Road and Edenhope-Penola Road.
  • Fergusons Road, west of Powers Creek.
Smoke:
  • Smoke from this fire may cause poor visibility. Take care while driving in the area and avoid roads where visibility is poor.  
Air quality: 
  • Due to smoke from the fire, air quality may be very poor in the surrounding area. Consider actions to reduce your exposure. Close windows and doors, and open them when air quality improves. Reconsider planned outdoor activities. People with underlying respiratory or cardiac issues should avoid smoke. 
Support:
  • For relief support call 13 99 72. Press option 3 for support. 
  • For metal health support, call Rural Outreach on 1300 688 732.

This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 01/01/2022 08:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Apsley, Chetwynd, Connewirricoo, Dergholm, Dorodong, Edenhope, Harrow, Kadnook, Patyah, Ullswater.

  • There is a grassfire at Poolaijelo that is not yet under control.
  • This grassfire is travelling in a north-easterly direction and has crossed Fergusons Road, near Ryans Road. 
  • Surrounding communities may see smoke from fire activity in the Meereek State Forest. 
  • Fire crews have been building containment lines around the northern and eastern sides of the forest to help stop the spread of the fire. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions.

Air Quality:
  • Due to smoke from the fire, air quality may be very poor in the surrounding area. Consider actions to reduce your exposure. Close windows and doors, and open them when air quality improves. Reconsider planned outdoor activities. People with underlying respiratory or cardiac issues should avoid smoke. 

Support:

  • For metal health support, call Rural Outreach on 1300 688 732.
Impacts in your area: 
The following roads are closed: 
  • Casterton-Apsley Road between Dergholm-Edenhope Road and Edenhope-Penola Road.
  • Fergusons Road, west of Powers Creek.
Smoke:
  • Smoke from this fire may cause poor visibility. Take care while driving in the area and avoid roads where visibility is poor. 

Air Quality:
  • Due to smoke from the fire, air quality may be very poor in the surrounding area. Consider actions to reduce your exposure. Close windows and doors, and open them when air quality improves. Reconsider planned outdoor activities. People with underlying respiratory or cardiac issues should avoid smoke. 

Support:
  • For relief support call 13 99 72. Press option 3 for support.
  • For mental health support, call Rural Outreach on 1300 688 732.

This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 02/01/2022 12:20 am or as the situation changes.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for The Honeysuckles.

  • Due to a whale carcass, there could be an increase in shark activity at The Honeysuckles near Ninety Mile Beach.
  • A whale carcass can attract sharks to the area and mean they are closer to the shore than normal.
  • While it is not uncommon for sharks to be present off the Victorian coast, you should exercise additional caution in the area.
  • The Victorian Fisheries Authority is assisting Wildlife Officers and Park Rangers with the management of the whale carcass.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued on 22 December.
Stay informed and do not enter the water at closed beaches.
What you should do:
  • If you see sharks, report the sighting by calling Triple Zero (000) or notify lifesavers immediately if you are at a patrolled beach.

Staying safe at nearby beaches:
  • Always swim, dive or surf with a friend.
  • Swim between the red and yellow flags on patrolled beaches.
  • Don't swim in places where human or animal waste enters the water.
  • Keep away from large schools of fish, seals or other wildlife as these can attract sharks.
This message was issued by Victorian Fisheries Authority.

The next update is expected by 05/01/2022 03:00 pm or as the situation changes.

For more information on staying safe around sharks:
  • www.vfa.vic.gov.au/shark-smart.
Stay informed:
  • Via www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
  • Call the VicEmergency Hotline to talk to someone about this warning on 1800 226 226 (freecall).
  • People who are deaf, hard of hearing, or who have a speech/communication impairment can contact VicEmergency Hotline via the National Relay Service on 1800 555 677.
  • For help with English, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to telephone VicEmergency Hotline. If you know someone who cannot speak English, provide them with this number.
  • Download the VicEmergency app or follow VicEmergency on Twitter or Facebook.

cap.senderName: Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Hattah, Murray-sunset, Ouyen.

  • There is a bushfire 3 kilometres South of Hattah that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is moving in a south south eastly direction along the Calder Highway and into Hattah-Kulkyne National Park. 
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 

  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads, including the Calder Highway. 
This message was issued by Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning.

The next update is expected by 01/01/2022 06:50 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Aberfeldie, Airport West, Albion, Ardeer, Ascot Vale, Avondale Heights, Braybrook, Brooklyn, Brunswick, Brunswick West, Coburg, Essendon, Essendon Fields, Essendon North, Essendon West, Flemington, Footscray, Kealba, Keilor, Keilor East, Keilor Park, Kensington, Kingsville, Maidstone, Maribyrnong, Moonee Ponds, Niddrie, North Melbourne, Oak Park, Parkville, Pascoe Vale, Pascoe Vale South, Port Melbourne, Seddon, Spotswood, St Albans, Strathmore, Strathmore Heights, Sunshine, Sunshine North, Sunshine West, Tottenham, Travancore, Tullamarine, West Footscray, West Melbourne, Yarraville.

  • There is a grassfire at Raleigh Rd, Maribyrnong that is not yet under control.
  • The fire is contained to the North by the Maribyrnong River but has the potential to jump the river.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.


What you should do:
  • Monitor conditions.
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • The fire is showing significant amounts of smoke that is visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Roads in the vicinity may be closed to allow firefighters to work in the area
  • Residents north of the fire that border the Maribrynong River - including Smiley Cres, Lily St, View St and Prospect St should be vigilant to the possibility of the fire crossing the river.
This message was issued by Fire Rescue Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 01/01/2022 05:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Tarwin Lower, Venus Bay. 

  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued Friday, 31 December at 11.44pm.
  • Increased wind has increased smoke in the area; communities may see smoke throughout Saturday, into Sunday 2 January. 
  • Emergency services and fire brigades are on scene attending to the fire; drivers are advised to exercise caution. 
People located within Tarwin Lower, Venus Bay are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Inverloch-Venus Bay Road is now open.The Venus Bay Surf Lifesaving Club relief centre is closed. 
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Cavendish, Gatum, Mooralla.

  • There is a grassfire at Mooralla that is under control.
  • This grassfire is located between East West Road, Luhrs Road, and Cavendish-Glendinning Road. The fire has crossed Luhrs Road. 
  • The fire is approximately 180ha in size. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads.

    The following roads are closed in the area:
  • Cavendish-Glendinning Road from Glendninning to the corner of the Natimuk-Hamilton Road near Cavendish. 
  • East West Road from the Cavendish-Glendinning road to Craigs Road, near Mooralla. 
  • Montana Road and Kelsall Solidier Settlement Roads are closed. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 01/01/2022 06:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Stawell.

  • There is a grassfire at Pickering Rd, Stawell that is not yet under control.
  • This grassfire is travelling in a north-easterly direction towards Stawell. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 01/01/2022 05:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Issue Date: Saturday 01 January 2022, 03:15 pm
Next Update: Saturday 01 January 2022, 05:20 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/19457/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Stawell.

- There is a grassfire at Pickering Rd, Stawell that is not yet under control.
- This grassfire is travelling in a north-easterly direction towards Stawell. 


There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
